data.title: Beyoncé (Singer)
data.meta_description: Rose to fame in the late 1990s as lead singer of R&B girl-group Destiny's Child. Her songs are often characterized by themes of love, relationships,...
data.text:
Full Name: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter

Profession: Singer

Biography: Rose to fame in the late 1990s as lead singer of R&B girl-group Destiny's Child.

Her songs are often characterized by themes of love, relationships, and monogamy, as well as female sexuality and empowerment. On stage, her dynamic, highly choreographed performances have led to critics hailing her as one of the best entertainers in contemporary popular music.

Throughout her career, she has won 32 Grammy Awards (group and solo), surpassing Hungarian conductor Georg Solti of the Chicago Symphony as most decorated, in 2023. Her solo career has generated over 200 million record sales, and a further 60 million with Destiny's Child, making her one of the best-selling music artists of all time.

Born: September 4, 1981

Birthplace: Houston, Texas, USA

Age: 42 years old

Generation: Millennial

Chinese Zodiac: Rooster

Star Sign: Virgo

Articles and Photos

The Loudest Noise in a Rolls-Royce is the Electric Clock

One was from an impoverished background; the other was a member of the aristocracy. They came together to form Rolls-Royce, the iconic car manufacturer.

Married Life

Singer-songwriter and actress Beyonce Knowles (30) weds rapper Jay-Z (43) at a 13,500-square foot penthouse apartment in New York

Historical Events

20th MTV Video Music Awards: Missy Elliott, Beyoncé and Justin Timberlake win

18th Soul Train Music Awards: R. Kelly, Janet Jackson, Outkast & Beyoncé win

21st MTV Video Music Awards: OutKast, Beyoncé & Usher featuring Lil Jon & Ludacris win

"Irreplaceable" single released by Beyonce (Soul Train Music Awards Best R&B/Soul Single 2007, Billboard Song of the Year 2007)

"We Are One" concert at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington prior to Barack Obama's inauguration attracts an estimated crowd of 400,000; performers include: Beyoncé, Jon Bon Jovi, Garth Brooks, Mariah Carey, Josh Groban, Herbie Hancock, John Legend, Pete Seeger and Bruce Springsteen, U2, and Stevie Wonder

26th MTV Video Music Awards: Beyoncé, Taylor Swift & T.I. f/ Rihanna win

Glastonbury Festival in Pilton, England opens: U2, Coldplay, and Beyoncé headline; other performers include B.B. King, Paul Simon, Mumford and Sons, Morrissey, and Wu-Tang Clan

"Love On Top" single released by Beyoncé (Grammy Award Best Traditional R&B Performance 2013, Billboard Song of the Year 2012)

26th Soul Train Music Awards: Miguel, Beyoncé win

"Beyoncé" 5th studio album by Beyoncé is released

Beyoncé releases her 6th album "Lemonade" with a 1 hour film on HBO

24th Billboard Music Awards: Drake wins 13; Beyoncé and Twenty One Pilots win 5 each; Justin Timberlake wins 2

Beyoncé is the first black woman to headline the Coachella Music Festival, her performance on this day the most-watched performance ever on YouTube

Beyoncé and Jay-Z release their joint album "Everything is Love"

Beyoncé releases a live album of her 2018 Coachella performance on the same day as her Netflix documentary "Homecoming"

63rd Grammy Awards: Beyoncé breaks record for most Grammys won by a singer (28), Taylor Swift wins Album of the Year and Billie Eilish Record of the Year

Beyoncé becomes first black woman and third person to wear the Tiffany Diamond in an advertising campaign for the company alongside her husband Jay-Z

Beyoncé’s single "Break My Soul" is her first solo #1 on Billboard's Top 100 in 14 years, the same week her "Renaissance" album reaches No. 1 on Billboard's 200 chart

65th Grammy Awards: Best Album Harry Styles "Harry’s House”, Best Record Lizzo "About Damn Time", Best Song Bonnie Raitt “Just Like That”, Beyoncé breaks record for most wins with her 32nd Grammy

Beyoncé begins her Renaissance World tour in Stockholm, Sweden, her first solo tour in seven years

Concert film “Renaissance: A Film by Beyoncé” premieres at the Samuel Goldwyn Theater in Beverly Hills

Beyoncé’ is the first Black female artist to top Billboard's Hot Country Songs Chart, with her country single “Texas Hold ’Em”

Beyoncé releases her eighth studio album "Cowboy Carter", the second in a trilogy after "Renaissance"

Biographies and Sources

Beyoncé dances with giant robot arms on opening night of Renaissance World Tour - CBS News

Beyoncé Initially Planned to Release ‘Cowboy Carter’ Before ‘Renaissance,’ but ‘There Was Too Much Heaviness in the World’ - Variety

Beyoncé Makes History as First Black Woman Atop Hot Country Songs Chart - Billboard

Grammys 2023: Winners List - The New York Times

Inside Beyoncé’s ‘Renaissance’ Concert Film World Premiere with Lizzo, Halle Bailey, Janelle Monáe and More - Variety

‘Break My Soul’ Becomes Beyoncé’s First Solo No. 1 on the Hot 100 in 14 Years - Variety
